results.title: Protective Effect and Potential Mechanism of Simvastatin on Myocardial Injury Induced by Diabetes with Hypoglycemia.
results.text_hl: The cardiac protective effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment (at a dose of 40 mg/kg d) upon @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@diabetic hypoglycemia@@@ models was assessed.

results.title: Reduced coronary events in simvastatin-treated patients with coronary heart disease and diabetes or impaired fasting glucose levels: subgroup analyses in the Scandinavian Simvastatin Survival Study.
results.text_hl: Reduced coronary events in @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@-treated @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Coronary_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D003327 @@@coronary heart disease@@@ and @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ or @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@impaired fasting glucose@@@ levels: subgroup analyses in the Scandinavian @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ Survival Study.

results.title: Lymphocyte-suppressing and systemic anti-inflammatory effects of high-dose metformin in simvastatin-treated patients with impaired fasting glucose.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Sixty-two subjects with @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@impaired fasting glucose@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@IFG@@@) treated for at least 3 months with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ were allocated into one of two groups receiving, respectively, @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ (3 g daily) or placebo for the following 90 days.

citations.NLM: Krysiak R, Okopien B. Lymphocyte-suppressing and systemic anti-inflammatory effects of high-dose metformin in simvastatin-treated patients with impaired fasting glucose. Atherosclerosis. 2012 Dec;225(2):403-7. PMID: 23107042
citations.BibTeX: @article{23107042, title={Lymphocyte-suppressing and systemic anti-inflammatory effects of high-dose metformin in simvastatin-treated patients with impaired fasting glucose.}, author={Krysiak R and Okopien B}, journal={Atherosclerosis}, volume={225}, number={2}, pages={403-7}}

results.title: The effect of fenofibrate on lymphocyte release of proinflammatory cytokines and systemic inflammation in simvastatin-treated patients with atherosclerosis and early glucose metabolism disturbances.
results.text_hl: The study included 47 @DISEASE_Atherosclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D050197 @@@atherosclerotic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with the concomitant presence of @<m>DISEASE_Hypoglycemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007003 @@@impaired fasting glucose@@@ and @DISEASE_Glucose_Intolerance @DISEASE_MESH:D018149 @@@impaired glucose tolerance@@@ already receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment (40 mg daily) who were allocated to one of two groups treated for 90 days with, respectively, @CHEMICAL_Fenofibrate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011345 @@@fenofibrate@@@ (200 mg daily) or placebo.

citations.NLM: Krysiak R, Gdula-Dymek A, Okopien B. The effect of fenofibrate on lymphocyte release of proinflammatory cytokines and systemic inflammation in simvastatin-treated patients with atherosclerosis and early glucose metabolism disturbances. Basic Clin Pharmacol Toxicol. 2013 Mar;112(3):198-202. PMID: 22935083
citations.BibTeX: @article{22935083, title={The effect of fenofibrate on lymphocyte release of proinflammatory cytokines and systemic inflammation in simvastatin-treated patients with atherosclerosis and early glucose metabolism disturbances.}, author={Krysiak R and Gdula-Dymek A and Okopien B}, journal={Basic Clin Pharmacol Toxicol}, volume={112}, number={3}, pages={198-202}}
